definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Conrad Murray, Michael Jackson's doctor, was found guilty of involuntary manslaughter.
sentences.chinese: 米高積遜的醫生默裏被控非自願性誤殺罪名成立。

sentences.english: The Second part is the relation between voluntary disclosure of business information and high-quality financial report.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是自願性信息披露與高質量財務報告。

sentences.english: Contingencies are the key to voluntariness.
sentences.chinese: 或有費用是自願性的關鍵。

sentences.english: The basic feature of positive comity is its voluntariness.
sentences.chinese: 積極禮讓的基本特徵是它的自願性。

sentences.english: This thesis thinks that the voluntary disclosure of information contributes to offering the high-quality financial report.
sentences.chinese: 本文認爲自願性信息披露有助於提供高質量財務報告。

sentences.english: Canada sought to dilute a new treaty outlawing enforced disappearances.
sentences.chinese: 而加拿大試圖淡化一個禁止非自願性失蹤的新條約。

sentences.english: Have you ever experienced a government-mandated or voluntary recall of any products?
sentences.chinese: 貴公司的產品是否曾被政府強制性或自願性回收？

sentences.english: This was later amended to simply "starvation", after protests from the dead strikers' families.
sentences.chinese: 驗屍官將驗屍結果記錄爲“飢餓，自願性”。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to reduce payment/to annul (debts, bills, taxes etc)/to let sb off paying
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
